results.title: Under western skies
results.brief_description: A survey of the dry farming and the irrigation farming practices carried out in the western states of USA furing the 1940’s. Criticism made towards farmers, ranchers and timber merchants for land abuse, soil degradation and water irrigation. Examples shown of conservation farming.

results.title: Under the weather = A L'ombre
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Yves Leduc, Pierre Heberrt and Tali
results.brief_description: A delightful animation without narration about a group of happy vacationers who are lounging on a beach enjoying a lazy afternoon, but under cloudy skies things soon take a disturbing turn. This was the first animation by Tali who won the contest Cineastes Recherches du Studio d’Animation du Programme Francais de l’ONF in 1994.

results.title: Under the weather
results.brief_description: In this whirlwind of stop motion animation, everday domestic objects are whipped into movement by a runaway weather report. A mixture of object animation and live action.

results.title: Under the skin (E)
results.creator_credit: Kate Ogburn, BFI, Channel 4 Films, Strange Dog Prod and Carine Adler
results.brief_description: Samantha Morton is Iris, a young woman who is increasingly estranged from her happily married older sister, Rose (Claire Rushbrook). When their mother is diagnosed with a terminal disease Iris is thrown into such a turmoil of grief, anger and despair that she leaves her home, her job and her boyfriend and attempts to dull her pain by immersing herself into a frenzied abuse of alcohol, drugs and sex. As if countering her jealousy of Rose by becoming her exact opposite, Iris involves herself in casual sado-masochistic encounters that leave her both exhilarated and disturbed. “Under the Skin” won the Jury Prize at the Toronto Film Festival and the Michael Powell Award at the Edinburgh Film Festival. Carine Adler’s debut feature film dares to tackle the ambiguities and contradictions of female sexuality and female competition in a contemporary world were many of the challenges of second-wave feminism have become accepted and institutionalised. In allowing Iris to be boldly naked - physically, metaphysically, and emotionally - Samantha Morton creates an unique and stunning central character. Cast also includes Rita Tushingham as the mother.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kate Ogburn, BFI, Channel 4 Films, Strange Dog Prod and Carine Adler

results.title: Under the rainbow = Sous l'arc-en-ciel
results.brief_description: A little good will goes a long way—between persons, and between nations. That is the lesson to be learned from this animated film. It begins with a confrontation between a man who grows flowers and a technologist who operates computers. A flower pops up in the computer room; a computer tape appears in the garden. Each man destroys the “foreign object.” When they come face to face they discover that understanding is better than distrust, respect better than hostility. Without dialogue.

results.title: Under the radar
results.creator_credit: Macquarie Nine Film and Television Investment Fund, Pictures in Paradise, Chris Brown, Chris Fitchett and Evan Clarry
results.brief_description: Punctured with light-hearted comedic situations this thriller is part road movie, part gangster film. Adrian (Clayton Watson) who has severe amnesia and Trevor (Steady Eddy) who has cerebral palsy, are at a home for people with disabilities. When Brandon (Nathan Phillips), a local surf champion, turns up to do some Community Service as a result of a recent fracas, the three realise a road trip to the beach would break the monotony of daily life and provide some fun. Along the road they pick up the beautiful but mysterious hitchhiker Jo (Chloe Maxwell). The happy-go-lucky trip however takes a nasty turn as they stumble into a gang war and unwittingly find themselves in mortal danger. Cast includes Marg Downey.

results.title: Under the one roof
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Ageing in the New Age”.
Some cultures such as the Australian Aboriginal, Western Samoan and Chinese still maintain traditions of respect and status for their older members. This film looks at some families in Australia (a country where the nuclear family is the norm) who are maintaining extended family life styles. Suitable for middle and upper secondary level.
